title: Favicon Handling Plan
description:
## Overview

Plan and implement comprehensive favicon validation for the xhtml-test project. Modern favicon requirements have evolved significantly - browsers now support SVG favicons with dark mode, PWAs need specific icon sizes, and Apple devices require touch icons.

## Research Summary

### Modern Favicon Requirements (2025)

Per [Evil Martians](https://evilmartians.com/chronicles/how-to-favicon-in-2021-six-files-that-fit-most-needs) and other sources, the minimalist modern approach needs just 5 files + manifest:

1. **favicon.ico** (32×32) - Legacy browser fallback
2. **icon.svg** - Scalable, supports dark mode via CSS media queries
3. **apple-touch-icon.png** (180×180) - iOS home screen
4. **icon-192.png** (192×192) - Android/Chrome
5. **icon-512.png** (512×512) - PWA splash screens
6. **manifest.webmanifest** - PWA icon definitions

### Required HTML Markup

```html
<link rel="icon" href="/favicon.ico" sizes="32x32">
<link rel="icon" href="/icon.svg" type="image/svg+xml">
<link rel="apple-touch-icon" href="/apple-touch-icon.png">
<link rel="manifest" href="/manifest.webmanifest">
```

### Dark Mode Support (SVG)

```html
<link rel="icon" href="/favicon.svg" type="image/svg+xml" 
      media="(prefers-color-scheme: light)">
<link rel="icon" href="/favicon-dark.svg" type="image/svg+xml" 
      media="(prefers-color-scheme: dark)">
```

## Implementation Plan

### 1. Favicon Checker Script (`scripts/favicon-check.js`)

Validates:
- Presence of required favicon link elements in HTML
- Favicon files exist on filesystem (ico, svg, png)
- Apple touch icon present for iOS
- Manifest file exists and contains icon definitions
- Icon dimensions are correct (using sharp)
- SVG favicon contains dark mode media query (optional/recommended)
- No CDN/external favicon URLs (local only, matching project philosophy)

Exit codes: 0 = pass, 1 = errors found

### 2. Favicon Skill (`.claude/skills/favicon/`)

Guide Claude on:
- Modern favicon file requirements
- Correct HTML link element markup
- Manifest.webmanifest icon definitions
- Dark mode SVG techniques
- Maskable icon safe zone (409×409 centered in 512×512)
- File naming conventions

### 3. Metadata Profile Updates

Extend `.claude/skills/metadata/profiles/default.json`:
- Add favicon link elements to recommended section
- Add apple-touch-icon to recommended
- Add manifest link to recommended (for PWAs)

### 4. Test Fixtures

Create test fixtures:
- `test/fixtures/valid/favicon/complete.html` - All required favicons
- `test/fixtures/valid/favicon/minimal.html` - Just ico fallback
- `test/fixtures/invalid/favicon/missing-apple.html` - No touch icon
- `test/fixtures/invalid/favicon/no-favicon.html` - Missing entirely

### 5. npm Script

Add to package.json:
```json
"lint:favicon": "node scripts/favicon-check.js"
```

## Validation Checks

| Check | Severity | Description |
|-------|----------|-------------|
| favicon.ico exists | Error | Legacy browser support |
| icon.svg exists | Warning | Modern browser scalable icon |
| apple-touch-icon.png exists | Warning | iOS home screen |
| manifest.webmanifest exists | Warning | PWA support |
| Icon dimensions correct | Error | 32x32 ico, 180x180 apple, etc |
| No external URLs | Error | All favicons must be local |
| SVG dark mode | Info | Recommended for theme support |

## Dependencies

- `sharp` - Already in project for image dimension checking
- No new dependencies required

## Related Issues

- Integrates with existing metadata-check.js patterns
- Similar structure to web-vitals-check.js and image-check.js
- Follows project philosophy: local dependencies only, no CDN

## Resources

- https://evilmartians.com/chronicles/how-to-favicon-in-2021-six-files-that-fit-most-needs
- https://web.dev/articles/add-manifest
- https://maskable.app - Maskable icon validator
- https://realfavicongenerator.net - Favicon generator

description:
## Research Complete

See `webhint-exploration.md` for full analysis.

### Summary

**Recommendation**: Do not adopt webhint. Create unified `site-check.js` instead.

**Reasons**:
1. webhint has deprecated dependencies and maintenance concerns
2. webhint lacks robots.txt, 404, LLM support, content quality checks
3. webhint errors on local files (jsdom canvas issues)
4. Our current 13 scripts already cover most needs

**Proposed Solution**: Create `scripts/site-check.js` that consolidates:
- Favicon validation (ico, svg, apple, manifest icons)
- robots.txt validation
- sitemap.xml validation
- manifest.webmanifest validation
- 404 page detection
- llms.txt (LLM/AI crawler support)

This replaces the individual planning beads (xhtml-test-c1f, xhtml-test-mfl, xhtml-test-ry3, xhtml-test-e8l) with a single consolidated implementation.
close_reason: Research complete - see webhint-exploration.md. Proceeding with site-check.js implementation.

title: Site scaffolding skill for standard static site structure
description:
Create a skill for scaffolding new static sites with a standardized structure.

## Problem
When creating new sites (like demo-site-claude, demo-site-claude-2), we start from scratch each time. We should have a consistent baseline with all the standard files a production site needs.

## Proposed Structure
```
site-name/
├── index.html              # Homepage
├── 404.html                # Error page
├── 500.html                # Server error page
├── robots.txt              # Search engine directives
├── humans.txt              # Credits/team info
├── sitemap.xml             # Site map for crawlers
├── manifest.json           # PWA manifest
├── browserconfig.xml       # Windows tile config
├── .htaccess               # Apache config (optional)
├── assets/
│   ├── css/
│   │   └── main.css        # Main stylesheet with @layer structure
│   ├── js/
│   │   └── main.js         # Main script (progressive enhancement)
│   └── images/
│       ├── favicon.ico
│       ├── favicon.svg
│       ├── apple-touch-icon.png
│       ├── icon-192.png
│       ├── icon-512.png
│       └── og-image.png    # Social sharing image
├── pages/                  # Additional pages
└── components/             # Reusable HTML partials (for SSG)
```

## Skill Features
1. Generate scaffold with configurable site name, description, author
2. Include proper meta tags, Open Graph, Twitter cards in base HTML
3. Favicon set with all required sizes
4. CSS with design tokens and @layer structure
5. robots.txt with sensible defaults
6. sitemap.xml template
7. 404/500 error pages with consistent styling

## JavaScript Stub
The main.js should include:
- Init function triggered by DOMContentLoaded
- Module pattern or ES modules structure
- Progressive enhancement approach (site works without JS)

```javascript
document.addEventListener('DOMContentLoaded', init);

function init() {
  // Site initialization
}
```

## Future Expansion
- SSG variant for Astro
- SSG variant for 11ty
- Separate boilerplate repos

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Skill file created at .claude/skills/site-scaffold/SKILL.md
- [ ] Scaffold includes all standard files
- [ ] JS stub has init function with DOMContentLoaded listener
- [ ] Generated HTML passes all project validation
- [ ] Can be invoked to scaffold a new site directory
close_reason: Site scaffold skill implemented with 15 template files
